chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is an 83-year-old male with severe liver dysfunction attributed to abiraterone acetate. Initial lab results showed AST 1243 IU/L and ALT 540 IU/L. During treatment, AST increased to >8000 IU/L and ALT to >3000 IU/L as peak values. Other liver function indicators such as ALP, GGT, Bilirubin, INR, and Albumin were not explicitly mentioned in the text. The clinical outcome was improvement and discharge after treatment.
